abstract: Wells Fargo receives $185 million in fines for opening bank and credit card accounts without customer consent or knowledge; federal banking regulators say practice dates back to 2011 and reflects serious flaws in bank's corporate culture; fines include $100 million penalty from Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, largest it has ever issued.
lead_paragraph: Federal banking regulators say that the bank issued unauthorized credit cards and charged late fees on accounts created by bank employees but not authorized by customers.
snippet: Federal banking regulators say that the bank issued unauthorized credit cards and charged late fees on accounts created by bank employees but not authorized by customers....

headline.main: Wells Fargo Fined $185 Million for Fraudulently Opening Accounts
headline.print_headline: Wells Fargo Fined for Setting Up Sham Accounts
